text: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar (19 October 1910 â€“ 21 August 1995) was an Indian Physicist. He received the 1983 Nobel Prize in Physics alongside William Alfred Fowler "for his theoretical studies of the physical processes of importance to the structure and evolution of the stars". He was born in Lahore now Pakistan until 1916, his family came and settled in Allahabad then in 1918, moved to Madras. He died in Chicago. == Related pages == *Chandrasekhar limit *List of Nobel Prize winners from India *List of Nobel Prize winners in Physics == References == Category:1910 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Physicists
title: Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
